summary: This document is an email chain forwarding a letter from The New York Times Company requesting the unsealing of records in the case US v. Tartaglione (16-cr-832). The correspondence involves a federal prosecutor and New York Times legal staff.

persons.name: Al-Amyn Sumar
persons.context: Sends the email attaching the New York Times Company's letter requesting unsealing of records in the Tartaglione case.

persons.name: Ben Weiser
persons.context: Named as the reporter on whose behalf the New York Times Company is requesting unsealing of records.

persons.name: Davi
persons.context: Appears as a recipient (Cc) in the email chain regarding the unsealing request.

persons.name: McCraw
persons.context: Appears as a recipient (Cc) in the email chain regarding the unsealing request.

persons.name: Tartaglione
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case (US v. Tartaglione, 16-cr-832) for which records are being requested to be unsealed.

connections.description: Sumar works in the legal department of The New York Times Company and is acting on behalf of reporter Ben Weiser regarding the unsealing request.
Sumar includes Davi as a recipient (Cc) in the email regarding the legal matter.
Sumar includes McCraw as a recipient (Cc) in the email regarding the legal matter.

events.title: New York Times requests unsealing of Tartaglione case records
events.description: The New York Times Company sends a letter to the court requesting the unsealing of records in the case US v. Tartaglione (16-cr-832).

keyFacts: The New York Times Company formally requested the unsealing of records in the criminal case US v. Tartaglione (16-cr-832).
The request was made by the Times' legal department on behalf of reporter Ben Weiser.
The correspondence shows media interest in accessing sealed court records related to the Tartaglione case.
The document is dated September 10, 2019, and involves communication between a federal prosecutor and New York Times legal staff.
